question_text: Why does NVMe achieve significantly lower latency than AHCI when used with SSDs?
answer_options: It supports older protocols that use larger command sets
It directly maps storage to memory over PCIe with multiple queues
It allows SSDs to access spinning platters more efficiently
It compresses data blocks automatically before writing
correct_answer: It directly maps storage to memory over PCIe with multiple queues
explanation: NVMe leverages PCIe to support thousands of simultaneous queues with deep command support, eliminating AHCI's legacy single-threaded bottleneck.
